intro: Korthalsella rubra subsp. rubra, commonly known as the red korthalsella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, although it is relatively rare in the wild.
